full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 87 of 228 763 LC2Qmax3 Rocchio - Cross 1 A. Correct. 2 Q. And neuropsychology is the study of the human behavior as it relates to normal and abnormal functions of the central nervous system, correct? 3 4 A. Sure. 5 6 Q. And that involves the brain, which is a significant part of the central nervous system, right? 7 8 A. Yes. 9 Q. You're not a toxicologist, which involves a specialized study of the effects of alcohol and drugs on the human body, correct? 10 11 A. Correct. 12 13 Q. You did talk a little bit about disclosure and memory. Do you recall that testimony? 14 15 A. I believe I spoke about disclosure. 16 Q. Right. And delays in disclosure, right? 17 A. Correct. 18 Q. And memory is a factor that contributes to a potential of delay in disclosure, correct? 19 20 A. It can. 21 Q. And there are two components to whether people can accurately remember things as part of disclosure. One would be the physical ability for someone to store or retrieve a memory? 22 23 24 A. Is that a question? 25 Q. Yes. Is that correct? SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012372
